record.title: Gamma-ray observations of SN 1987A from Antarctica
record.author: Rester, A. C.
Coldwell, R. L.
Dunnam, F. E.
Eichhorn, G.
Trombka, J. I.
Starr, R.
Lasche, G. P.
record.affiliation: AA(Florida, University, Alachua), AB(Florida, University, Alachua), AC(Florida, University, Alachua), AD(Florida, University, Gainesville), AE(NASA, Goddard Space Flight Center, Greenbelt, MD), AF(NASA, Goddard Space Flight Center, Greenbelt, MD; Catholic University of America, Washington, DC)
record.journal: Astrophysical Journal, Part 2 - Letters (ISSN 0004-637X), vol. 342, July 15, 1989, p. L71-L73.
record.abstract: Gamma-ray lines from the direction of supernova 1987A have been observed with a Ge detector flown on a high-altitude balloon platform over Antarctica in January 1988. Gamma rays at 844.1 + or - 1.0 and 1239.9 + or - 1.5 keV, with fluxes 0.0023 + or - 0.002 and 0.0021 + or - 0.001 photons/sq cm sec, respectively, are attributed to the radioactive decay of Co-56. Errors quoted do not include possible systematic effects.
